Authors:
Jun Liang Zhou, Sheng Yu Su, Hong Yan Su, Philippe Callac,
Jacques Guinberteau, Bo Wang, Kevin D Hyde, Rui Lin Zhao
Title:
Agaricus section Xanthodermatei from Tibet and surrounding
area with descriptions of eleven new species
Abstract:
Specimens from Agaricus section Xanthodermatei from Tibet
and surrounding area are well studied. All specimens are conducted by
critical morphological examination and molecular phylogenetic analysis
based on ITS, LSU and tef-1ï¡ sequences using Bayesian and Maximum
Likelihood methods. Twelve specie are recognized in this research, and
eleven of which are reported as the new species, one are new records
from China, and five specimens are unnamed because of the lacking of
some morphological information. All proposed new species are described
in details along with the colored plates. The phylogenetic of this
section have been improved based on multilocus sequences and extensive
samplings especially the type species. The phylogenetic topology from
this study shows section Xanthodermatei composed of three lineages
(named as XanI, II and III), which is similar to the previous research.
However, clade XanII did not get supporting in mathematical statistics
in both 3-genes and ITS sequences analysis; and clade XanI is loosely
related with other Xanthodermatei clades. So we proposed the strong
supported clade XanII+III (In both 3-genes and ITS analysis) is a core
clade of this section.
